eS-SZOMqLuzB4Db7q0UQuA.text: This is a hidden gem in the heart of Edinburgh! We tried a couple starters that were off the chain. All of our entres were also great. Very fresh and all culinary wonderwalls! Thanks for the great conversation and delicious food.   Give this place a try!

XXC9aEFaCXfar0q-UDRICA.text: We loved our meal here. I had a great glass of sparkling rose to start. I had a wonderful vegetable curry. The staff was super nice and fit us in last minute . The menu is eclectic and the seating is definitely cozy. I would return.

tdooK-NZ53XThzleeUfLTg.text: We had the most amazing dinner at this restaurant, which feels like a local in all the best ways - wonderfully friendly staff who go the extra mile, and delicious food. Standouts were duck croquettes, hake with risotto and basil gnocchi.  The savoury dishes outshone the desserts but it was overall very hard to fault.

upehH4xB7V9L85TnVWF14Q.text: The Educated Flea is one of three restaurants making up a local chain and after having been to the Three Birds for my birthday dinner a few weeks prior I was looking forward to trying out their newest place. We made a last minute booking on a Thursday as I'd had a pounding headache all day and having been to work to a training course to book club, I decided I couldn't face cooking. Thankfully they had a table free :)   The restaurant is tiny, maybe 20 covers, so a booking is definitely needed. The menu has a good list of options with daily specials listed as well. On this night we skipped alcohol as my headache didn't require wine to feel worse. We spilt the pistachio and feta dip and some olives and then I had the aubergine parcels. The dip was with us shortly as was a bowl of enormous green olives. The dip was super tasty and just a tiny bit spicy with the olives being super brine-y and really moreish.   Mains arrived in good time and my aubergine parcels were stuffed with smoked aubergine pate on top of herbed rice with tomato and feta. It was a really tasty and fresh dish without being super filling and just what I needed after a super busy day with a pounding headache.  As my head had decided it had enough for that day we skipped pudding and headed on our way.  The bill was quite reasonable at just over 30 for our two mains and shared starters so definitely a place for a refined dinner without a huge cost. Also if you're super hungry I'd recommend the birds and beast board full of meaty treats!

photos.caption: Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Baked cod when lentil curry
Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Aubergine parcels with rice and feta cheese

4LoYzPkEICJ3jckTV02C_w.text: Had lunch here last week and had a great time. Service was great and being sister to Apiary and 3 Birds means they have a good gluten free selection which is always handy to know.  The food was good, still a few things to fine tune, but nothing to complain about.  It's a small space as Fiona said, but it's nicely furnished and feels quite spacious.  Would happily come back for another meal. Nice to have some new options on Broughton Street to add to the old faithfuls!

photos.caption: Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ribs
Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Squid special
Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gluten free beer!

QAKsqIK_WimvsQdvkTR7dw.text: First night in Edinburgh and what a wonderful dining experience. The specials are creative and delicious. I tried the smoked mozarella with tomato puree. The highlight was the venison with herb mashed potatoes and green beans. I will definitely return

LDZ3BNR-xx4b906HdrnlyQ.text: Pleasant service, delicious meal with fresh, versatile ingredients and tons of flavor.  A stepped up, more modern twist from the traditional Scottish fare, while still maintaining that homely feel.  Cozy atmosphere, would recommend making a reservation although they did their best to accommodate walk-ins.  Would definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Roast chicken
Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb two ways
Photo of Educated Flea - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetable Curry

GMI1zsYQ8anpc87irL5RFA.text: We had a lovely meal two weeks ago at the Educated Flea. It's is very small and you are in quite close proximity to your fellow diners, but we didn't mind.  The service and the food were really lovely.  We enjoyed everything we tried.  This restaurant was recommended to us and I certainly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal.

_OeIogYMkneejNyo3FJEDg.text: I hate dining out alone but as a tourist had no choice. I was made to feel right at home in this snug little restaurant. I had an amazingly delicious vegetarian dish with quinoa and vegetables, and a glass of wine, and enjoyed the view out the window. It was perfect. The presentation was outstanding, the waitstaff just attentive enough. Lots of conversation going on around me, but the noise level was just fine. Menu is wonderful: lots of great options for a vegetarian. I wanted to try everything, so will definitely return when next in Edinburgh.

i6TIrxRphBBGfMYPSgSNXw.text: Came across this place by chance, so glad I did! Had dinner on this visit, and definitely be going back again to try their brunch.

Nbm48qN21IpW_WLbIGC2hw.text: Writing this review a week after trying out this new restaurant on Broughton Street, which was offering a discount its opening weekend in return for giving the staff feedback on the courses you tried. It's a smaller sized restaurant but airy with contemporary decor, so it's a nice space to spend time in. Staff were very friendly and informed about the food. Wine we chose was really good. For veggie me, the choice was great - fab range of vegetables and pulses being used in the cooking.

lVNNKaYjuvbhT63y28rQpw.text: One of the few truly gluten free/food allergy/dietary restriction spots in the city. Absolutely amazing food and great ambiance. My partner is gluten and lactose allergic and they catered fantastically to her. We always need to worry about cross contamination but since the restaurant is "naturally gluten free" there was no worry and we enjoyed a relaxed meal for a very reasonably price. The gluten free bread was fantastic (especially with the Smoked shallot vinegar), and both the main dishes we had (duck leg and venison) were to die for. I am super excited to try the other restaurants under the owners (3Birds and Apiary) and will be extremely happy if they are half as good as this.

BuSH8SoHqULdwBT5cgDgKg.text: Last second dinner on 4/30 (and called in for res). Met owner Kath, and what a charmer!! Wife had lamb shank, daughter had duck and I had special steak - ALL entree's were excellent. We did dessert and coffee, and saw the several potential customers come in without reservations, and had to be turned away- tells you something good about the restaurant.  So, service was excellent as was the food!  Will try one of Kath's other restaurants this trip (Apiary) and I assume it will be as excellent. Would for sure recommend, and if not for living in the US would make this a regular stop.

ed1PDLlRTiik2PNvqULaZA.text: The owner and staff of this place are a well selected group of gems who masterfully execute the inviting yet relaxed dining experience that keeps me coming back here. The food is incredible and you can tell that every dish is a well thought out combination of ingenuity and expertise on a plate. All this without being intimidating or overly showy. It's just good food and really enjoyable dining. The chef, staff, and owner really go out of their way to make you feel like they've been waiting for you to stop in their whole lives...like you're family or friends of the family. Chef is a charmer. Food is exciting. Staff is friendly. What else  could you ask for. Pistachio feta dip and coconut sorbet are must haves. Brisket is delish. Prawn starter salad is fresh and so tasty. Enjoy, I know I do!

u-F7bLcU_TWrVFpiNERbQA.text: I really liked this place! Fresh ingredients, fun menu, friendly service.
